text: Françoise Seligmann (born Françoise Jullien; 9 June 1919 in Marseille – 27 February 2013 in Neuilly-sur-Seine) was a French journalist, resistance fighter, and politician. She was awarded the Legion of Honor. == Life == In December 1941, she joined the French resistance where she worked with Roland de Pury, Marcel Peck , and Claude Bourde. She was a member of Combat (French Resistance). In 1946, she founded La Française. From 1955, she worked with Pierre Mendès France. From 1992 to 1995, she was senator from Hauts-de-Seine. She created Fondation Seligmann, to support human rights. == Works == * Liberté, quand tu nous tiens ... Fayard, 2000. * == References == == Other websites == * https://www.fondation-seligmann.org/ Category:1919 births Category:2013 deaths Category:French journalists Category:Politicians from Marseille Category:Recipients of the Order of the Legion of Honour
title: Françoise Seligmann
